1104F76BA4F84429B9C76913D81F5EC1.description: Investigate the trade qualifier pathway as an alternate pathway to certification in a non-compulsory trade in Saskatchewan.

7149C91553E94E6E8DBE12EAAAB1095A.description: Differentiate between compulsory (i.e., construction electrician, plumber, refrigeration and air conditioning mechanic, sheet metal worker and sprinkler fitter) and non-compulsory trades in Saskatchewan.

E36A34DB7CCD4408A1DC006D35E41F04.description: Explore opportunities and programs that address the issue of underrepresented populations in the trades.

B201272082F64C63931B734FB76FC8C8.description: Discuss requirements and opportunities for apprentices and journeypersons to train and work in other jurisdictions.

7834BC98EECE4968A74A706D9866CE69.description: Research the qualifications needed to obtain Red Seal and Blue Seal certifications.

D3165C2C8D564AAA99A3A51E85C9682C.description: Use appropriate trade-related terminology including: apprentice; journeyperson; indenture; pre-employment training; designated trade and sub-trade; and, advanced standing.

0532EAFE9AB848FDB8A7E6471B72BD0A.description: Investigate the apprenticeship process in a trade of personal interest.

7AFFCBD1B6E04096B22242FE4FC3AFAA.description: Investigate available programs and opportunities such as the Saskatchewan Youth Apprenticeship program and secondary apprenticeship credits that support transitions from high school.

707B02BC8A6742B0A7E8FBBBD54621CE.description: Discuss the relationship between the trades and national, provincial and territorial certification bodies including the Saskatchewan Apprenticeship and Trade Certification Commission.

1D305F13FD6944D0A0D8690133A457E3.description: Describe qualities of a successful apprentice.

4707A01A2F7B435495BBC66CDE3D83CA.description: Explore the advantages and disadvantages of apprenticeship for the individual and the trade.

DE8DDC6296DC4F71B7E68A80298BF4B6.description: Research the history and the role of apprenticeship in the trades.

F46AEBA052A4424B9237DB52A54B702C.description: Outline an entry level business plan that may include start-up costs, location, customer base, advertising and an exit plan.

71A38632F11648619D3D3281327ECC12.description: Explain the responsibility of a business owner to employ individuals with various levels of training (e.g., apprentice, journeyperson and Red Seal) and to provide quality customer service.

F15844A86AA24BCFB546D6E1A324517C.description: Explain the advantages of and requirements for obtaining Blue Seal certification.

03AE323B7933412390FC5F763C82A0AA.description: Research the importance of sustainable business practices such as providing quality customer service, following environmental guidelines and employing qualified and certified personnel.

3B09E50D722C43D5AA95DCEDD03C8A10.description: Research the requirements (e.g., registering business name, collecting and remitting taxes, licensing and zoning) for establishing a business in one’s community.

A1E4C523CEBB4238B50B6FA564F03DF4.description: Explore the role of franchises as a business ownership model in the electrical and electronics industries.

94A7A80498794F359A236AEFBECE32CE.description: Investigate the advantages and disadvantages of different business ownership models, including sole proprietorship, partnerships and private corporations.

47E9B7C631E343F1B310440382C9E522.description: Explore electrical and electronics-related business opportunities in sectors such as agriculture, mining, power generation, communications providers and construction.

8EB6B19597764DD3B07729F896F97572.description: Research the types (e.g., retail and wholesale outlets, electrical contractor and manufacturing) of business opportunities available in the electrical and electronics industries.

58C8123E4FF44CFA885F54374DC89ABF.description: Investigate business opportunities in the electrical and electronics industries.

F3FA94CF2ACE4B08A0865BC63C86C4F8.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

C11452EC4DDB46EC8068B3398EDA3C21.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

3D06F4FA4FAA4115AC5591E844721EF7.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

1974AC1C5BCE4749A1F7D322F7F45C57.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

3834BC83D51F4DBE895508163956A8B4.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked;, responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

F2CA0CD4CC334B6CA5806A47C6981313.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

74396696466F42049DD61BE9A0F0DE10.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

8AFA9B279751432A87113D0B4364D8F2.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

753F2CB408594F6FB50217C8D8D22665.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

715B255259BA484A98B4EFEEDBA87483.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

BC5B41029A02420697E18169BC337441.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

32E0609B31254DFC919425350C2C0B24.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

64091C331BA7422D8952764106BB0D11.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

C06754A9B6C847E49D0BE9F303E832E9.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

80EA3365972F458CA4C21C1DD475CF0F.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

063FBDFF2F96470C9283DBD432A82BEF.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

972C38AC69CC4809B09E1301463BB8C8.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

61F9C147FD3043FBA5575C6BB5A9A7B0.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

5F11343657DE42E385EAAB2C2993C07F.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

559D961732F14BB89599C82CF7F1F47F.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

F3BE799689A74972B82143A242625234.description: Demonstrate increasing proficiency in electrical and electronic-related techniques, work skills and presentation skills.

2447E416CAAD40D5B7375DE063F3396F.description: Assemble and present a project utilizing skills in planning and management as outlined in Module 37 Introductory Project.

1EB3E8F9E68D412ABF6594D3C03084D6.description: Construct an advanced level assigned or approved electrical or electronics project.

EE2AA9DA3B554BBEB8A7215BEAA6603A.description: Construct and test the operation of a comparator.

1432A7BC3BD84729AD025DFACF0533EE.description: Explain the operation of a comparator, including its use in A/D converters.

8F01154890FA4B14AEFDF350FC51CE82.description: Construct and test the operation of A/D and D/A converters.

77D2E0412455473696C77FF0536A78EA.description: Explain the processes of analog to digital (A/D) and digital to analog (D/A) conversion.

C29A6EA4E17C43EF81462AC25865038E.description: Examine the operation of analog and digital converters.

F5611CB1B5914C559645BDBF02F915FD.description: Construct and test the operation of serial and parallel shift registers.

DABCC08D84184BFA87E2B098188200E5.description: Construct and test the operation of a circuit used for frequency division.

24E44E877EAA4506A8BEB295CA8A111E.description: Compare the operation of different types (e.g., up, down, synchronous, asynchronous and decade) of counters.

BBC155EA63A1482C923F8B0CCDB0B5A3.description: Explain the purpose and operation of a counter in digital electronics.

BFAF8F2B241B45F49F768F35F1D74472.description: Examine the operation of digital counters and shift registers.

492451AA5BAB45D397504B3E6DE98FB4.description: Construct and describe the operation of sequential logic circuits.

19B53BB7E3EA4713BD049692454AB801.description: Explain the operation of common flip-flop types, including SR, D, T and JK.

274DA51DA99A40689BD30499ED0348FD.description: Provide examples of applications of sequential logic circuits.

36F4F001001F49DE85AB046AD961529C.description: Differentiate between sequential and combinational logic.

5EA99ADED2164707ADB6C448CAE3F776.description: Explore the use of binary and hexadecimal codes in digital electronics.

45A0436CDFF348CF9E89E789C3F89FA9.description: Explore the purpose and operation of sequential logic circuits.

583E022F7E3347958D554B74D2477611.description: Determine the most suitable type of rectifier for specific applications.

C5F6ED1768B74A4BB4A3D04056197F75.description: Analyze the shape of the output wave of half-wave, full-wave and bridge rectifiers using an oscilloscope.

4FA6E01C06B9419A853F939AB20DB63A.description: Construct and measure the output voltage of half-wave, full-wave and/or bridge rectifiers.

5036FDDBF37D4ACFBA4A03239DF6C170.description: Draw graphical representations of the output voltage of half-wave, full-wave and bridge rectifiers.

B43AA36848C7499395F0D0EED220A68A.description: Differentiate between half-wave, full-wave and bridge rectifiers.

A4147885470E481399F0A22DD6F30629.description: Explain the purpose and operation of rectifiers.

D07C66B88BC14EB29452541A0F5CB3C7.description: Demonstrate safe practices when working with power supplies.

BBED5D161BAC4EF3849648D6EA19DA49.description: Construct and test a rectifier for use in a power supply.

94EEC879C7D94C33A6A776B46B3ECEDB.description: Test the PCB, using a multimeter, for electrical continuity to match design layout.

BFFE42FF56AA4F8AA9E9303D6702778F.description: Use appropriate processing procedures (e.g., processing PCB in chemical etchant and drilling holes) to preserve conductive material for the chosen method.

5F1A8BF3C61D4CD6A915ACAB4E5FB5D6.description: Determine an appropriate layout design for the chosen method of fabrication according to industry standards (e.g., appropriate use of space on the PCB and minimizing jumper wires).

C4D873DB38CF47AB84E33EB4156D3EBC.description: Describe different methods (e.g., chemical etching, photo etching, silk screen, CNC and proto-board) of PCB fabrication.

C3E9B3EE95BC49CF95DB1C2E17D03481.description: Demonstrate safe practices when working with PCBs.

0601EA2E1B084EDB906FB64357E04E1B.description: Investigate how microcontrollers control various output devices.

6B34741559E3419BA01BADFAAB7D3B2C.description: Investigate how microcontrollers read and interpret data from different types of inputs.

857FB10CEE4C4852810A6910B75300DB.description: Explore how to program a microcontroller to perform specific functions or tasks.

3089454C7C224F0DABD525B7BB6348E3.description: Describe the purpose of different types of analog and digital input/output pins that may be found on a microcontroller.

B925DD82E96740EA9B88CAA74584722D.description: Critique different microcontrollers for functionality and uses.

CCE8FDCFE2F44196AF5689C0C046CF6B.description: Interpret datasheets to determine characteristics, features and applications of specific microcontrollers and/or microprocessors.

AF15B68854C04D7BA79516FF9A7F4ABC.description: Identify the limitations of a microcontroller, including maximum current limits and input and output voltage ranges.

42B27834B77C40E3A269CB8077FAB8C2.description: Provide examples of applications of microcontrollers.

50AF86FD6E794E5781EB106E7F2E42F7.description: Investigate how microcontrollers can be used to control electronic devices.

EAA8FF338F914BD5B84E97C76D7788B3.description: Investigate the effects of improved manufacturing processes on IC design.

B43DAF43C4F249AFB85F1FEC7B1CB64C.description: Research the intellectual property issues related to IC products and layout designs.

D8382EC117DC44AF86F3F564B4A75DE9.description: Differentiate between transistor-transistor logic (TTL) and complementary metal oxide semiconductor (CMOS) ICs.

B2D534BFB93545AFB2F92BE2B691C0D1.description: Interpret datasheets to determine physical and electrical characteristics, features and applications of specific ICs.

2456A73A234248B9BE8606987823161B.description: Describe the common logic families for ICs.

7D760DA6C8E84796A7B81D9DC5144330.description: Analyze conventional circuits to determine how ICs may replace some or all of a conventional circuit.

4FBE0F02D3E342DD9DCABEA03D6AAE56.description: List advantages and disadvantages of using ICs rather than conventional circuits.

F5C37CF0323D4965814D7A7ADB4D6573.description: Investigate the operating characteristics of integrated circuits (ICs).

9EB2D20A41804A509D68B9C4E93E2912.description: Compare the purpose and application of various types (e.g., direct, resistive-capacitive, impedance and transformer) of coupling.

D570DA46F19248BFBF894627B3E4F661.description: Explain how a small change in emitter voltage causes a large change in collector voltage in a common-base circuit.

A8A524043B6F4859B5A15C5993258A6A.description: Explain how a small change in base voltage causes a large change in collector voltage in common-emitter and common-collector circuits.

3E16DF39B3EB4D5DB0E9BDEF39FD3BCF.description: Troubleshoot an altered common-emitter amplifier circuit; common-collector amplifier; and, common-base amplifier.

704AC62E7FEA4F3A974033D3F5C00CB4.description: Draw schematic diagrams showing correct biasing (i.e., polarity and voltage level) of an NPN and PNP transistor in a simple common-emitter circuit; common-collector circuit; and, common-base circuit.

34BE6BAAE7F5492DBD5CDB97F2CD2650.description: Compare the characteristics and applications of transistor amplifier circuits (i.e., common-emitter, common-collector and common-base).

C0EB1E9687EA4182A9E488B395E7912D.description: Analyze electronic circuits that contain negative-positive-negative (NPN) and positive-negative-positive (PNP) transistors.

5DC1DAE1B2C14737A571A01BC4D662C2.description: Provide examples of applications of RC circuits.

60B2374C4DED4CDD87CC4BB5F0490AAB.description: Investigate how to combine resistors and capacitors to control charge and discharge time.

F23825E7962340058B0BE799D13B6E29.description: Explain the function of RC circuits, including the role of the time constant.

16419F3943EF4B71A83AF9C4C4999A0E.description: Describe the charging and discharging process of a capacitor.

9FF56180B15B457BB41D298C06B054C6.description: Identify risks and potential safety hazards (e.g., tools on floor, exposed live wires and extension cords).

AEBC4FEB2EB541AD9E6C564538A59C8A.description: Describe the importance of a clean work area and methods used to maintain a clean work area.

29179BF4D721469FB64B01B0E2C144BB.description: Identify hazardous materials and relevant WHMIS procedures.

EAE47C1FA0ED4DABB79452870B5E229D.description: Explain the purpose of ventilation in a confined environment.

2FA88FE12D1442B1B7051F61A46E39AD.description: Discuss appropriate actions in case of an injury or accident, such as whom to contact and first-aid procedures.

5D446D1440CC4965A9E0FD1E47E2687A.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury or material and equipment damage as a result of unsafe work acts or environments.

609BA5BAF20A4A41AA051CD1749663DC.description: Review the fire evacuation plan for the work area including the location of fire alarms, fire extinguishers and exits.

92E351F761584FAAA14C735D7A75DE35.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE) such as safety goggles, footwear, hearing protection, headwear and protective clothing.

108BC70B9C384428970EA24766721725.description: Recognize and apply safe and fair work practices including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

3133630685184EE2935E08ED0A238705.description: Apply principles and techniques for injury prevention to ensure safety in the work area.
